cheem 0.1.9000
  • Reference

Linked plotly display, global view of data and attribution space.

Source: R/2_visualization.r
global_view.Rd

from a cheem_ls() list, create a linked plotly of the global data- and attribution- spaces. Typically consumed directly by shiny app.

global_view(
  cheem_ls,
  primary_obs = NULL,
  comparison_obs = NULL,
  color = NULL,
  shape = NULL,
  height_px = 480L,
  width_px = 1440L,
  as_ggplot = FALSE
)

Arguments

cheem_ls

A return from cheem_ls(), a list of data frames.
primary_obs

The rownumber of the primary observation. Its local attribution becomes the 1d projection basis, and the point it highlighted as a dashed line.
comparison_obs

The rownumber of the comparison observation. Point is highlighted as a dotted line.
color

A vector to map to the point color. Classification case defaults to predicted class, regression case defaults to class if passed to cheem_ls(), else residual.
shape

A vector to map to the point shape. Classification case defaults to predicted class, regression case defaults to class.
height_px

The height in pixels of the returned plotly plot. Defaults to 480.
width_px

The width in pixels of the returned plotly plot. Defaults to 1440.
as_ggplot

Logical, if TRUE returns the plots before being passed to plotly functions.

Value

plotly html widget of the global view, first 2 components of the basis of the data- and attribution- spaces.

See also

Other cheem consumers: radial_cheem_tour(), run_app()

Examples

library(cheem)

## Regression:
dat <- amesHousing2018_NorthAmes
X <- dat[, 1:9]
Y <- log(dat$SalePrice)
clas <- dat$SubclassMS

rf_fit <- default_rf(X, Y)

#> default_rf: 0.22 sec elapsed
## Long runtime for full datasets:
shap_df <- attr_df_treeshap(rf_fit, X, noisy = FALSE)

#> Started attr_df_treeshap() at: 2021-11-25 16:40:36
#> attr_df_treeshap: 1.73 sec elapsed
this_ls <- cheem_ls(X, Y, class = clas,
                     model = rf_fit,
                     attr_df = shap_df)

#> cheem_ls: 0.16 sec elapsed
global_view(this_ls)
